biography.name: Tunku Abdul Rahman
biography.title: Bapa Kemerdekaan

image.alt: Tunku Abdul Rahman delivering a speech on Malaysian independence.
image.caption: Tunku Abdul Rahman delivering a speech on Malaysian independence.

timeline.event: Born on February 8, in Alor Setar, Kedah, Malaysia, into the royal family of Kedah.
Attended Debsirin School in Bangkok and Penang Free School in Penang.
Moved to the United Kingdom to study law at St. Catherine's College, Cambridge.
Returned to Malaya after failing law exams; began work in the Kedah State Civil Service.
Appointed Assistant District Officer in Kulim, Kedah, and served in different regions.
Returned to Cambridge and successfully completed his law degree.
Joined UMNO and began advocating for Malaya's independence after WWII.
Elected UMNO president, advocating for independence from British rule.
Became Chief Minister and led negotiations for independence.
On August 31, led Malaya to independence, becoming the first Prime Minister.
Promoted ethnic integration and established Malaysia’s neutral foreign policy stance.
Formed the Federation of Malaysia, including Sabah, Sarawak, and Singapore.
Declared a state of emergency after the May 13 Incident, addressing ethnic tensions.
Stepped down as Prime Minister and continued to advocate for unity.
Passed away on December 6, remembered as Malaysia's 'Father of Independence'.

biography.quote: We are all Malaysians. This is the bond that unites us. Let us always remember that unity is our fundamental strength as a people and as a nation.

biography.name: Tun Abdul Razak
biography.title: Bapa Pembangunan

image.alt: Tun Abdul Razak delivering a speech.
image.caption: Tun Abdul Razak during an event.

timeline.event: Born on March 11 in Pekan, Pahang, Malaysia.
Studied at Malay College Kuala Kangsar before pursuing law at the University of London.
Graduated from Lincoln’s Inn in London as a trained lawyer.
Joined the Malayan Civil Service and quickly rose in UMNO's ranks.
Appointed Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defense after independence.
Initiated the FELDA program to reduce poverty in rural areas.
Led the National Operations Council (NOC) to restore order following the May 13 Incident.
Became Malaysia's second Prime Minister and launched the New Economic Policy (NEP).
Announced the National Education Policy to promote Malay as the national language.
Established diplomatic relations with China.
Launched the Green Book Program to increase food production and self-sufficiency.
Promoted Malaysia's role in the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) and OIC.
Passed away on January 14 while receiving treatment in London.

biography.quote: Development is essential for our nation’s future.
